result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael John Nickel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Undergo anger management counseling and parenting classes. Follow all other rules of probation. Six month periodic review to be done.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael John Nickel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's probation terminated on 3-20-16; unpaid supervison fees of $720
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 3-20-16; unpaid court obligations of $185.86; hard copy received on 1-4-16
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Michael John Nickel, appeared pro se. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court went over the right to an attorney. Defendant waived attorney. Rights & elements recited. Defendant plead guilty to count one. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 1 year probation, conds: undergo anger management counseling and parenting classes, follow all other rules of probation, six month periodic review, $443 court costs. No jail credit.

Defendant, Michael John Nickel, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appearing on warrant, quashed, bond cont'd  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 03:00 pm. and Return date 3/20/15 at 2:45 P.M. Br. 3
for failure to appear at the 2/9/15 Pretrial Conference
No violent or abusive contact with A.J.N. or H.M.N.  Standard misd. conditions.

Defendant, Michael John Nickel, appeared. Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  $200.00 signature bond.  No violent or abusive contact with A.J.N. or H.M.N.  Standard misd. conditions.  Previously posted bond may be returned to poster.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 01:40 pm.  Hearing scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
